issue.title: Voiceover translator
issue.body:
Is it possible to add a voiceover translator? 

It is very stable by the sites from the list given in the link. As far as I understand, this cannot be applied to already downloaded videos, only to the video at the link.

https://github.com/ilyhalight/voice-over-translation/blob/master/README-EN.md

comment.body:
For audio/video support IINA uses a library from the [mpv](https://github.com/mpv-player/mpv) project. In turn that project uses [yt-dlp](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp) for streaming. It is `mpv` that is playing the audio. A voiceover translator feature would have to be implemented by [mpv](https://github.com/mpv-player/mpv/issues).

From a brief look at [Voice-over-translation](https://github.com/ilyhalight/voice-over-translation/blob/master/README-EN.md) it looks like it is setup to be embedded in a web browser. There may be some issues with embedding it in other environments.

issue.title: Follow user focus Fullscreen/Windowed <=> PiP
issue.body:
<!-- Please use English, if possible. If you really feel the need to use a different language to get your point across, you may add a description in your native language to supplement your report. -->
<!-- Please also try to search for your request to avoid it being closed as a duplicate. -->

**What you want IINA to do:**
When the user is viewing a video in fullscreen that uses a dedicated MacOS space, enable IINA to automatically toggle on PiP mode when going to another space than the IINA one ; and when the user goes back to the IINA fullscreen space, transfer back video playback from PiP to IINA fullscreen space.
To sum it up: _follow the user focus_ by switching automatically between Fullscreen playback and PiP mode
Similarly: automatic switch between windowed playback and PiP mode to follow user focus.
I suggest adding these 2 optional settings in Settings / Picture-in-Picture below existing ones:
- Follow user focus when in Fullscreen playback
- Follow user focus when in windowed playback


<!-- Fill this out if IINA already does something similar, or you would like to change some current behavior. -->
**What IINA does currently:**
Currently the user needs to manually toggle on PiP to keep an eye on the video playing in another space (either fullscreen / in a window)

**Why you think this should be added:**
Seamless video playback experience whatever the user is doing (either 100% focussed on the video or doing other stuff at the same time)

<!-- If applicable. -->
**Examples of other projects that have something similar:**
Youtube Android (and iOS?) app (Premium subscription or (re)vanced enhanced) is able to switch on PiP mode when focussing out of the app while playback is running.

comment.body:
Hundreds of `didChangeScreenParametersNotification` is alarming. Seems Apple has been changing critical code again.

macOS Sonoma 14.1 has been released. Maybe Apple has fixed some of this?

comment.body:
> Upgraded to Xcode 15.0.1 today. The Metal errors are now gone.

Spoke too soon 😕 Still getting the errors. Not every launch though. They seem to come in clusters.

Also now seeing tons of duplicate calls to `windowDidChangeScreen`. And for HDR videos, now seeing literally _hundreds_ of `NSApplication.didChangeScreenParametersNotification` notifications when opening or closing the window - but only about half the time!

Just FYI.

issue.title: Quitting IINA without closing windows causes Finder to malfunction
issue.body:
**System and IINA version:**

- macOS 14.0
- IINA 1.3.3

**Expected behavior:**
Quitting IINA without closing windows does not affect Finder behavior.

**Actual behavior:**
@Whizzbizz reports:
If you quit Iina without closing its windows beforehand, the Finder (M1 iMac, Sonoma) will not do anything with files opened by Iina before you open them again and close them "properly", and only then quit Iina.



**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open a file with IINA
- Quit IINA without closing the window
- Attempt to access the file in Finder

<!-- If your issue is related to playback, please check whether mpv has the same problem. If so, this might not be an issue with IINA but rather an bug with mpv. Try reporting an issue there. -->
- [ ] MPV does not have this problem.

Unknown.

**How often does this happen?**
Unknown.

- Attempt to access the file in Finder

<!-- If your issue is related to playback, please check whether mpv has the same problem. If so, this might not be an issue with IINA but rather an bug with mpv. Try reporting an issue there. -->
- [ ] MPV does not have this problem.

Unknown.

**How often does this happen?**
Unknown.

comment.body:
Thank you so much for reporting this problem was traced to the `QuickLookUIService` for `Finder`. I was wondering what could be causing this problem.

A typical programming error is to fail to close an open file. Usually it is caused by someone adding new code that fails to account for the need to close the file. Or it is due to an alternative code path that was not covered by testing.

I wonder if this problem is new to macOS Sonoma.

Now that the root cause has been identified I am going to go ahead and close this issue. If you do find that there is a problem with how IINA handles this, please feel free to reopen this issue or open a new one.

comment.body: My concerns about Iina (or ffmpeg) not closing files seem to be solved: today, I found that Apple's QuickLook service seems to be the culprit and that files can be moved properly after quitting the 'QuickLookUIservice (Finder)' in 'Activity Monitor'.

issue.title: Failed to download subtitles from assrt due to rate limit.
issue.body:
<!-- Please use English, if possible. If you really feel the need to use a different language to get your point across, you may add a description in your native language to supplement your report. -->
<!-- Please also try to search for your issue to avoid it being closed as a duplicate. -->

<!-- Change these to match your system. If you're using a version compiled from source, please mention so here along with the commit you're using. -->
**System and IINA version:**

- macOS 14.0
- IINA 1.3.3 Build 138

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Use assrt as source of subtitles
2. Choose a subtitle resource with more than 2 subtitles (which means there are more than 2 subtitles in the `filelist`, usually this happens when the resource contains subtitles for the whole season, rather than one episode)
3. It should pop up a hint to display the download task is failed.

**Cause analysis:**

After validating the API and server ability of assrt, this issue is in the IINA side. When use proxy tools such as Proxyman, it's easy to guess the assrt server limits the concurrency requests.

**How often does this happen?**

Quite often

comment.body:
Hello from a junior IINA developer. Thank you for reporting this and especially for posting a pull request with a fix.

On this:
> Maybe we could provide a window selector for users to pick files they want to download.

That is what `SubChooseViewController` is supposed to do? I'm only familiar with the code for [Open Subtitles](https://www.opensubtitles.org/en/search/subs). In `OpenSub` a `Subtitle` instance is associated with one subtitle file. In `Assrt` the `Subtitle` class contains a `fileList` property.  I know nothing about  this site's API so I'm not understanding why there are multiple files. Maybe the same subtitles are available in different file formats?

In any case at this time a more important consideration is this code:
https://github.com/iina/iina/blob/aa5a4158cef44e972c8515c2a723db14bc97bd83/iina/OnlineSubtitle.swift#L102-L105

The built-in online subtitle provider code is now considered [legacy code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legacy_code). This is because the plan is to switch to plug-ins for such implementation. The plug-in system is included in the current release of IINA, but is disabled as it is not quite ready to be officially released. The plan is to enable it in the upcoming feature release.

Given that, enhancements such as adding a window selector probably should be done as a part of the plug-in conversion.

Open Subtitles is shutting down their XMLRPC API at the end of 2023. I am currently finishing changing the current Open Subtitles legacy code to switch to their new REST API. This is a temporary stopgap solution that may end up going straight into the trash if a plugin implementation can be created in time to meet the deadline.

I'm thinking IINA should not rush the feature release. Given the limited time left in the year I plan on proposing that IINA release a maintenance release before starting to work on the feature release. I will add PR #4672 to the fixes that should be included in this release. Of course it will be up to the senior developers as to what plans are appropriate to adopt.
